content.question: Which of the following provides particle-level reasoning for the solubility of the two compounds?

choices.label: Molecules of both compounds are polar and will experience London dispersion forces only.
Molecules of both compounds have similar masses and therefore have similar London dispersion forces.

Molecules of propane have more available hydrogen bonding sites for <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules.

Molecules of dimethyl ether will experience hydrogen bonding attractions to <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules, but molecules of propane will not.

content.answer: Molecules of dimethyl ether will experience hydrogen bonding attractions to <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules, but molecules of propane will not.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
